title: Minor: "leptos.workspace = true" is invalid.
body:
This is a minor comment 

In my IDE .. I have a count of errors in the toolbar.
The error count registers invalid lines in toml files.

As a double check I dumped the root Cargo.toml files in a validator 

https://www.toml-lint.com/

So all my changes are of the form 

```
-leptos.workspace = true
+leptos = { workspace = true }
```

As I see things - This does not uncover any bugs, the original intend of the code in being interpreted without problem.

So it is just a DX thing for me - When I am making changes to the code I always have to ignore a these errors.

title: Pre resolved data
body:
So basically I provide a way to resolve data before calling the app. This is how it looks when using it:

```rust
        App::new().leptos_preloaded_data_routes(
                leptos_options.clone(),
                routes.to_owned(),
                data_populate,
                |cx, (data, theme)| view! { cx, <App theme data /> },
            )
    })
    
    async fn data_populate(req: HttpRequest) -> Result<(JsonResponse, Theme), actix_web::Error> {
       ....
    }
```

In the end, I made it as a new LeptosRoutes function, because like this it doesn't break backward compatibility. 

I will also need to refactor the integrations to support custom Actix Guards (my root path has a wildcard which means it needs to use a guard for Accept=text/html in order to not be used for things like favicon requests. 

Once the second refactoring is done, then we could discuss implementing any breaking changes.

Ping @benwis

title: Use envs for workspace config
body:
When using workspaces there can be many different `[[workspace.metadata.leptos]]` sections. 

There is no way for the LeptosConfig to know which one is used and it cannot be set by the server binary package either as one of them can be used in many `[[workspace.metadata.leptos]]` sections.

This solution uses creates the LeptosConfig from the environment variables set by `cargo-lepos`. When running the server binary outside of `cargo-leptos` (in prod) the env vars `LEPTOS_SITE_ADDR`, `LEPTOS_SITE_ROOT` and `LEPTOS_SITE_PKG_DIR` can be set using alternative ways (bash script, .env etc).

@benwis I know you are heavily opposed to this solution, but I frankly don't see any other.

body:
Previously I  have been sweeping up errors by running cargo clippy from the root directory.

Today I ran  "cargo clippy" from examples/hackernews.

The feature flags in this example change the build environment

running  "cargo clippy" here picks up a few more issues.

I WAS trying to fix issues class-by-class, but in this PR there are previously visited rules : -

Redundant clone issues.
clippy::uninlined_format_args

I hope that explains why some of these rules are re-appearing

Here is the clippy warning for a new ambiguous namespace issue found in the view macro

```
warning: `leptos_router` (lib) generated 3 warnings (run `cargo clippy --fix --lib -p leptos_router` to apply 3 suggestions)
    Checking hackernews v0.1.0 (/home/martin/build/leptos/examples/hackernews)
warning: The view macro is assuming this is an HTML element, but it is ambiguous; if it is an SVG or MathML element, prefix with svg:: or math::
  --> src/routes/stories.rs:51:30
   |
51 | ...                   <a class="page-link"
```

title: Generate Routes and pass them to Actix/Axum
body:
This PR provides a function to walk the Leptos router's app tree and produce a list of routes. Each integration has conversions to parse them into a format for either Actix or Axum, and then a trait to provide a `.leptos_routes()` extension for their respective routers.

This lets us avoid any wildcard routes for routing leptos! And allows you to define routes in only one place! We can do some server side error handling, and be a better neighbor for other services.

I also put in the changes from #241 which are simplified by this change. Take a look and let me know if you spot any issues. The Actix version especially needs some prodding, it's got some fairly involved regexs, as its pathing is quite different from leptos_router.

The todo_app_sqlite and todo_app_sqlite_axum extensions have been updated to the new format. I'll update the rest if it looks good. @gbj and @akesson does that look right?

title: Removing clone call where possible(round2).

Sorry for the noise,

title: Minor: Clippy format!() all variables now inlined.
body:
Here is link the clippy discussion

https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#uninlined_format_args

lots of changes of the form

```
-        _ => format!("{}/{}", site_root, pkg_path),
+        _ => format!("{site_root}/{pkg_path}"),
```

To me this is a very minor readability change... 
The real advantage is that things  I feel strongly about are often lost in the noise of a large list.

When a more pressing problem occurs ... I want to see it.

title: Clippy: Removed stray calls to .clone().
body:
```
cargo clippy

```

Clippy suggest that these .clone() calls are not needed.

I am not making any performance assertions -  that these calls are on a 'hot' path or anything,

 just suggesting doing less mem-copies is always good.

title: Fix warning about MetaContext so it's less misleading.
Give warning when shadowing a context in debug mode
`store_value`
body:
This PR allows you to store values in the reactive system, in exchange for non-reactive references that are `Copy` and `'static`. This means that any value can have the same `move`-ability and easy DX as the signal types, without triggering reactive updates.

This also migrates the `Signal` and `SignalSetter` wrapper types and the `Action` and `MultiAction` types so that they are backed by `StoredValue`s, which means that all of the framework's primitive types are `Copy`.

title: Fix build errors in `counter-isomorphic` when using `stable`
body:
I'm investigating using this framework, but prefer to use stable Rust, so just a couple of fixes to get the `counter-isomorphic` example building when enabling the `stable` feature.

Tested by enabling stable in the [counter isomorphic deps](https://gist.github.com/snapbug/49e0ad2512511e2ef86c85d9ea761a37), and building. Checked functionality remains correct for all the methods shown in both Safari and Chrome.

Note: I don't know that editing the example is necessarily a completely desireable fix, given the separation of `counter` and `counters-stable`, and I also noted in router/src/components/link.rs that there is a cfg_if separation of csr or hydrate and not, whereas components/form.rs also has a stable/not cfg_if.

title: Relax the `Debug` trait bounds on various types in `leptos_reactive`
body: See #179

title: Changes to leptos, leptos_meta, leptos_actix/leptos_axum, and leptos_config to support cargo-leptos-beta
body:
Hi @gbj and @akesson, I have made several changes to leptos to support the cargo-leptos beta.

I hope both of you can take some time to review this, especially @akesson since it needs to work with cargo-leptos. I think I have it working with my stack, but would love your input.

Changes:
- Add id prop to `<Stylesheet/>` component to allow cargo-leptos' new css feature to work
- Rename RenderOptions to LeptosOptions and delete KDL file writing
- Read LeptosOptions from Cargo.toml in the [package.metadata.leptos] section, sharing keys with cargo-leptos
- Conditional WASM filename based on PACKAGE_NAME env var. If deploying a bundle built with cargo-leptos, PACKAGE_NAME env var will need to manually set
- Allowed Server Functions to set status of form redirects

This should allow for one source of truth for people using cargo-leptos or wasm-pack, and streamline some things.

It appears that cargo-leptos beta also does not support workspaces, as a bunch of paths are relative to the cargo root, which changes to the workspace root when in a workspace. This will prevent modifying the examples in leptos(and having them run with cargo-leptos watch), at least with the present example format. It shouldn't deter operation with wasm-pack

title: fix warning, set initial value of counter
body:
trying out `leptos` for the first time, I noticed a warning in this example, which pointed to what appears to be a bug:

```
warning: unused variable: `initial_value`
  --> examples/counter/src/lib.rs:11:33
   |
11 | pub fn SimpleCounter(cx: Scope, initial_value: i32, step: i32) -> web_sys::Element {
   |                                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: try ignoring the field: `initial_value: _`
   |
   = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default
```

I think this resolves the problem

╰─>$ cargo leptos watch
Error: at `/home/nim/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/cargo-leptos-0.0.9/src/main.rs@104:58`

title: Allow Headers and Status to be set by components and Server Fns during initial SSR Load
body: This changes the ways Headers and StatusCode is set so that it can be set once in a server fn or element, and be set during server side rendering.

title: Give Axum access to Request and allow server functions to set status/headers/cookies
body:
This PR adds a `RequestParts` struct for Axum so that it can access most of the request, and a ResponseParts struct for Actix/Axum that lets server functions set headers and override status.

This should allow server fns to set cookies and headers, but only not on initial page load via SSR. The todoapp-sqlite and todoapp-sqlite-axum examples show an example of this in `get_todos()`.

The question is whether we want/need the ability to set custom headers/status on initial page load via SSR, and how to do that. I don't think Context exists on page load

body: added `update_returning` method variants to all Signal types, update_returning runs the closure and then returns its return value. Since the closure isn't guaranteed to be run, update_returning has to return `Option<U>`

I also updated the todo-sqlite and todo-sqlite-axum to show what that would look like.

I'd love to get input on this structure. I haven't fixed the tests or docs or most of the examples yet, so this is WIP
